history.text: Hey, I loved this movie!
I thought it was rather boring.
Oh, not me, anything with Benedict Cumberbatch is not boring.
I'm not into history, which probably explains why I didn't appreciate this film.
Have you read the book?
The information in the document says that 91% of critics liked it, which is usually a good sign, I can't see where the percentage of regular people is listed.
No, haven't read the book.
That's a good point.  I might have to give it another shot.  Usually I disagree with critics though.
I don't normally read too many biographies, I guess I feel about them like you do about history.
I thought the subject matter was very important, though, how he was treated by the general publiceven though he was basically winning the war for them.
Definitely.  If I had to choose between a history book and a history movie I'd definitely choose the movie.
It says in the information, though, that a lot of that conflict was injected into the movie and that it didn't really exist
I feel like movies exaggerate everything.
It's sad that he was bullied in school and even sadder that his love interest died before he could ever tell him that he was in love with him.

Well, to be honest this all happened at a time when people did think like that about being gay, though. I mean, I was born in the 1950's and we never even talked about the possibility that anyone was.
Yeah, that is sad. The whole movie was sad,he was basically a genius who was taken for granted by the dull normals.

That's a good point.  I was in my late teen
s before I even knew that gay was a thing.
It says in the document that they messed with the chronology of events in the movie, now I might HAVE to read the book!
I was surprised that he actually came out during that time... however, not surprised that he was told to keep it a secret.
The more we talk about it I kind of want to watch it again and possibly read the book to see what is different.
Hmmm, that seems to be a Hollywood thing, altering a story to make money rather than sticking to the real story. I hate that.
Yeah, I checked it out at the library and watched it,
I also really like Keira Knightley, but not as much as Cumberbatch.
I couldn't agree more!  I think they seem to leave out important parts and then they add things that really don't make a difference just to glam it up
Honestly I'd never heard of any of the actors in this movie before watching it.  They all did a great job thought!
Really, you never heard of Benedict Cumberbatch?
He is awesome!
I'm looking at the information and it says it all happens between WWI and WWII.
No I hadn't.  I'm going to have to look it up and see what else he is in.
I am particularly attracted to stories from that time.
I like to read about how Britain was involved in both wars before the US, I think as Americans we don't consider how scary it must've been for them and what they sacrificed before we went in.
I mostly like movies set in the present.  I'm embarrassed to admit it, but I find myself watching "stupid funny" type movies more than anything.
I like those, too, because you don't have to pay a lot of attention to them, this movie you really had to watch because of all the information, if you didn't follow it you'd get lost.

I wish I would have paid more attention to history in school.  There's so much I don't know because I didn't put forth any effort in learning about it.  I just had an automatic wall up when it came to history.  I always deemed it as boring without giving it a chance really.

That is probably why I became bored with it.  I have to be just in the right mood to really give my full attention to a movie.  Otherwise my mind is just going a  million miles a  minute and I can't concentrate.  I will give this movie another shot though... You have me convinced that it's better than I thought!
Wow, the last part blows my mind.
The part about where they destroy their work? Did they destroy the machine? I can't remember.
I was just thinking about how crazy that he came out to the same guy he ended up revealing as a spy.
The guy was probably trained to be charming or something, who knows.
I guess spies are trained to get your trust.
I knew there was something up with him!  I even told my husband that he was up to no good.
Lol.
So you were watching more closely than you thought!
I guess so!
I thought we were supposed to have 3 conversations, is this still the first one? I don't really understand how this works.
I'm confused too! Lol.
I think we might be done.
It said 20 minutes and it's been longer than that, right?
Definitely.
Okay, nice talking to you. Bye.
It was nice chatting with you!  I'm gonna see about watching this again.  Have a good night!
